text: a lot of people tell me that they don't
like Brussels sprouts I think they've
just never had them cooked properly we
have a whole great story in our November
issue on Brussels sprouts and one of the
most surprising dishes in it is this
Brussels sprout and shrimp stir-fry it's
so delicious and they cook so fast
you're really going to like it start off
with one pound of Brussels sprouts I
find that it's easier to trim them and
then cut them in half lengthwise and
then cut them into thin shreds with a
very very sharp knife you could use your
flute processor with the shredding
attachment the shreds won't be quite as
long and elegant and then of course you
have to wash your food processor which I
am completely against I'm so lazy
as with all stir-fries it's best to prep
everything ahead of time then when you
go to your stove you really have nothing
to do except throw it all in so once
that's done you need a couple cloves of
garlic couple three scallions and a very
spicy chili this is a Thai chili if you
can't get a Thai chili I would recommend
using maybe a Serrano chili beware
beware the evil tiny chili well you know
I like spice you take the chili and
really thinly slice it and then three
scallions the white and light green part
are going to get cooked with the
Brussels sprouts and the greens for
garnish so save those for later and then
two cloves of garlic very thinly sliced
I like to do it lengthwise I just like
the way that that looks and now we're
ready to cook take this stuff to the
stove with you all right I have my wok
preheating you can do this with a
skillet too you're probably just going
to want to cook in batches to the hot
wok add a tablespoon of vegetable oil or
peanut oil if you're not allergic that
works great swirl it around add your
Brussels sprouts see how hot did you
hear that that's a good sound stir it
around this should take about five
minutes to cook don't forget salt and
pepper
the yoozh these are almost done and add
my bean sprouts I've one cup of mung
bean sprouts let those cook first just
about a minute they really don't need to
cook that much you just want to soften
them down now what you want to do is
take these put them onto a platter and
you're going to cook your shrimp with
those aromatics that you prepared before
slide those out you can eat that just
like that that would be good add another
tablespoon of oil and your pan is still
hot
see how it's sizzling add your aromatics
don't stand directly over and let the
wafting fumes go into your notes because
you'll start coughing let them cook just
a tiny bit then add one pound of medium
shrimp how quickly this is coming
together now that everything is prepared
make sure you season every step of the
way because they're all going to get
combined together at the end not too
much so shrimps pretty salty
keep it moving around just so that
though that garlic and stuff in there
doesn't burn when the shrimp are done
it's time to combine the dish and add
your final flavorings and we are getting
very close to that they need to be
opaque throughout you'll notice the
shrimp just curl up upon themselves a
little bit that's a good sign that
they're getting done alright just put
those from right on top of your Brussels
sprouts and all that's left left is a
little bit of seasoning this is a really
good dish I highly recommend you try it
I know I say that all the time but I
really want you to experiment with this
because I think that you'll know no I
think you'll really like it I'm sneaking
a bite before I've even seasoned it
that's how much I love this dish alright
the final touch for this dish is just a
little bit of sesame oil I like to add
it at the end because the flavor
dissipates and gets kind of weird if you
cook in it so this is a toasted sesame
oil and you want two teaspoons drizzled
on top also once your sesame oil is open
make sure you keep it in the fridge so
it doesn't go rancid
then your scallions sprinkle those over
the top and then just as a final touch a
little bit of lime I like to cut it into
wedges and just serve it right on the
platter people can squeeze it over the
top themselves I really love this dish
and I think you're going to enjoy it and
it's a totally new different way to try
Brussels sprouts and I highly encourage
you to give it a try and check out all
of our other recipes in our November
issue of everyday food for some other
great ideas but especially this one
